meanings.definition: Done with great care and thoroughness.
meanings.sent1: She did a painstaking job on her art project, making sure every detail was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painstaking work on the portrait captured every tiny feature of the subject.
meanings.sent3: It was painstaking to watch the toddler try to tie his shoelaces, but it was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The detective's painstaking investigation uncovered the truth hidden in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's painstaking pruning transformed the unruly bushes into works of art.

meanings.definition: Requiring much care, effort, or time.
meanings.sent1: The restoration of the old house was a painstaking process that took months to complete.
meanings.sent2: The chef's painstaking preparation of the dish ensured it was a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: It was painstaking to untangle the mess of wires behind the TV, but it had to be done.
meanings.sent4: The writer's painstaking revisions turned the rough draft into a polished novel.
meanings.sent5: The mountain climber's painstaking ascent to the summit was filled with challenges and triumphs.
